hook:
Preparing for the Blackwell era. üöÄ

This week we shipped comprehensive deployment guides for running Flux and Z-Image on RTX 5090s via Vast.ai.
body:
It's not just about adding features; it's about keeping pace with hardware evolution and paying down technical debt. Here is what our team shipped in 43 merged PRs this week:

üõ†Ô∏è **Infrastructure & Hardware**
We added specific documentation for deploying our image generation stack on the new RTX 5090 instances. If you are looking to run high-end models like Flux or TwinFlow on the latest architecture, the path is now clear.

üßπ **Architecture Refactor**
We removed the model caching layer entirely from our MCP (Model Context Protocol) implementation. Sometimes the best code is deleted code. By fetching models directly from the API, we eliminated state synchronization issues and reduced complexity.

üîí **Security & Ops**
Hardened our cron jobs with separate authentication tokens for tier refills and prepared our codebase for Google Summer of Code (GSoC) contributors.

Open source moves fast. We're just trying to keep the documentation moving faster.
cta: Have you tested the 5090s for inference yet? Check out the repo to see the new guides.
full_post:
Preparing for the Blackwell era. üöÄ

This week we shipped comprehensive deployment guides for running Flux and Z-Image on RTX 5090s via Vast.ai.

It's not just about adding features; it's about keeping pace with hardware evolution and paying down technical debt. Here is what our team shipped in 43 merged PRs this week:

üõ†Ô∏è **Infrastructure & Hardware**
We added specific documentation for deploying our image generation stack on the new RTX 5090 instances. If you are looking to run high-end models like Flux or TwinFlow on the latest architecture, the path is now clear.

üßπ **Architecture Refactor**
We removed the model caching layer entirely from our MCP (Model Context Protocol) implementation. Sometimes the best code is deleted code. By fetching models directly from the API, we eliminated state synchronization issues and reduced complexity.

üîí **Security & Ops**
Hardened our cron jobs with separate authentication tokens for tier refills and prepared our codebase for Google Summer of Code (GSoC) contributors.

Open source moves fast. We're just trying to keep the documentation moving faster.

Have you tested the 5090s for inference yet? Check out the repo to see the new guides.

#OpenSource #AIInfrastructure #RTX5090 #DevOps #GenerativeAI

image.prompt: A professional pixel art infographic card for a tech update. Large, chunky pixel headline at the top reads 'WEEKLY SHIP: 43 PRs'. Below, a visual breakdown in a grid layout: Left side shows a detailed pixel art GPU icon labeled 'RTX 5090 READY'. Right side shows a broom icon labeled 'CACHE REMOVED'. Bottom section has a 'Security Hardened' badge. A cute pixel bee mascot in the corner is wearing a hard hat and holding a blueprint. Style: clean isometric pixel art, reminiscent of SimCity 2000 but modern. Color palette: Dominant lime green (#ecf874) background sections, cream white panels, dark navy text. Composition: Organized, infographic style, high legibility. Text must be: crisp, bold pixel font, no distortion.
image.text:
WEEKLY SHIP: 43 PRs
RTX 5090 READY
CACHE REMOVED

reasoning: The mention of RTX 5090 is a major engagement hook for the tech/AI audience on LinkedIn, as access to and performance of these cards is a trending topic. Combining this with 'deleting code' (cache removal) signals engineering maturity. The image uses the infographic style to convey velocity (43 PRs) and the headline feature (5090) at a glance.
